nodes.bodyText:
had to add these because spring will try to load the *.sql initialization files for each integration test. This will result in table already exists errors and failing tests when running tests with maven integration-heavy profile. Actually this currently fails on master as it is.
The two sql files are:

not needed for testing, since the only test making use of these entities is actually mocking the repositories
needed in the CacheApplication only if one uncomments the @ComponentScan annotation

Another solution would be to set the spring.datasource.initialization-mode=never in the test application.properties but that's not really a good option.
Or separate all these caching articles into their own separate maven modules and this way they would not interfere with each other.
